docs.snippet: John Patrick Shanley, the director of "Doubt," was standing on the rooftop of the London West hotel, and he was joined one by one by four actors nominated for an Academy Award - Meryl Streep, Viola Davis, Amy Adams, and Philip Seymour Hoffman....
docs.lead_paragraph: John Patrick Shanley, the writer and director of "Doubt," was standing on the rooftop of the London West Hollywood hotel Saturday night, and he was joined one by one by four actors nominated for an Academy Award - Meryl Streep, Viola Davis, Amy Adams, and Philip Seymour Hoffman. Some people complained that the Mr. Shanley, the man who gave them such juicy roles, was not among the nominated.
docs.abstract: John Patrick Shanley, the director of "Doubt," was standing on the rooftop of the London West hotel, and he was joined one by one by four actors nominated for an Academy Award - Meryl Streep, Viola Davis, Amy Adams, and Philip Seymour Hoffman.

headline.main: The Bagger in L.A.: The Upside of Downside

docs.snippet: There was brown liquor, along with flutes of champagne, for the talent coming down the red carpet at the Spirit Awards in Santa Monica on Saturday. Most attendees demurred until they got inside the big tent and were confronted anew by giant bottle...
docs.lead_paragraph: There was brown liquor, along with flutes of champagne, for the talent coming down the red carpet at the Spirit Awards in Santa Monica on Saturday. Most attendees demurred until they got inside the big tent and were confronted anew by giant bottles of whiskey. The Bagger spent some time on the carpet, but his pal Tricia Romano from Hollywood Life picked up some quotes while he was inside comparing his Oscar picks with some of the people inside:
docs.abstract: There was brown liquor, along with flutes of champagne, for the talent coming down the red carpet at the Spirit Awards in Santa Monica on Saturday. Most attendees demurred until they got inside the big tent and were confronted anew by giant bottles of whiskey.

headline.main: The Bagger in L.A.: Spirits and Spirits

docs.snippet: Rankings reflect sales, for the week ended Feb. 7, at many thousands of venues where a wide range of general interest books are sold nationwide. These include hundreds of independent book retailers (statistically weighted to represent all such out...
docs.lead_paragraph: Rankings reflect sales, for the week ended Feb. 7, at many thousands of venues where a wide range of general interest books are sold nationwide. These include hundreds of independent book retailers (statistically weighted to represent all such outlets); national, regional and local chains; online and multimedia entertainment retailers; university, gift, supermarket, discount and department stores; and newsstands. An asterisk (*) indicates that a book’s sales are barely distinguishable from those of the book above. A dagger (†) indicates that some bookstores report receiving bulk orders. Among those categories not actively tracked are: perennial sellers; required classroom reading; text, reference and test preparation guides; journals and workbooks; calorie counters; shopping guides; comics; and crossword puzzles. Expanded rankings are available on the Web: nytimes.com/books.

headline.main: PAPERBACK BEST SELLERS: FICTION: TRADE: Sunday, February 22nd 2009

docs.snippet: 8:30 P.M. (ABC) THE 81ST ANNUAL ACADEMY AWARDS Odds are that Barbara Walters, above with Hugh Jackman, will make Mr. Jackman cry when she interviews him on her annual Oscars special (see below). But will Mr. Jackman, this year's host, make the Osc...
docs.lead_paragraph: 8:30 P.M. (ABC) THE 81ST ANNUAL ACADEMY AWARDS Odds are that Barbara Walters, above with Hugh Jackman, will make Mr. Jackman cry when she interviews him on her annual Oscars special (see below). But will Mr. Jackman, this year's host, make the Oscar audience laugh? Nominees and celebrity guests will begin their parade in front of the paparazzi at the Kodak Theater in Los Angeles at 6, when Ryan Seacrest and Giuliana Rancic report for ''Live From the Red Carpet: The 2009 Academy Awards'' on E! ABC joins the coverage during the final half-hour in ''The Oscars Red Carpet 2009'' at 8. Highlights from the ceremony will be shown at midnight on ''E! After Party: 2009 Academy Awards.'' 5 P.M. (Fox) NASCAR '09: CALIFORNIA 500 Nascar makes its West Coast debut with this latest installment in the Sprint Cup, broadcast live from the Auto Club Speedway in Fontana, Calif. Mike Joy, Larry McReynolds and Darrell Waltrip call the action. Hugh Laurie of ''House'' is the grand marshal.

docs.snippet: Inside Abu Ghraib     Photographs capture the scene inside the walls of the infamous Abu Ghraib prison. The Iraqi government has forged ahead in reopening the prison, partly renovated with bright paint, colorful lampposts, flowers and plants, desp...
docs.lead_paragraph: Inside Abu Ghraib Photographs capture the scene inside the walls of the infamous Abu Ghraib prison. The Iraqi government has forged ahead in reopening the prison, partly renovated with bright paint, colorful lampposts, flowers and plants, despite the stigma from years of torture and abuse there during Saddam Hussein's rule and under American control.

byline.original: By EMILY OBERMAN AND BONNIE SIEGLER

docs.snippet: This aptly-titled Sunday crossword is a reflective collaboration by two terrific constructors....
docs.lead_paragraph: A cruciverbalist constructs crossword puzzles. For any artist, the creative process starts by staring at a blank canvas. Nothing happens for a while. Time slows down. The ticking of the clock gets louder. "Write what you know" -- that's always the advice. Tick, tick, tick. Every production begins with a sense that this time, a significant or lovely or amusing or somehow wonderful contribution to the world is waiting to be unlocked. Tick, tick, tick.
docs.abstract: This aptly-titled Sunday crossword is a reflective collaboration by two terrific constructors.
